results.title: Bluegrass country
results.brief_description: A film of the annual Bluegrass Music Festival at Berryville, Virginia. Conveys the history of this indigenous American folk-music through the high-energy performances of the professional musicans and impromtu jam sessions of their fans. The performers discuss their music. No other credits available.
results.description: A film of the annual Bluegrass Music Festival at Berryville, Virginia. results.title: Tennis basics: the backhand
results.brief_description: American tennis professional Dennis Ralston demonstrates the backhand stroke. Simple animated figures are used to show the basic positions of the arms, legs, body and head during each phase of the swing. Viewer participation is also included.

results.title: How to animate a gingerbread boy
results.brief_description: Demonstrates and explains the technique of motion picture animation. Intended for classroom use, this film illustrates various animation methods ranging from very simple to advanced and presents them in a way that explains the technical mysteries and permits the student to focus on the art of animation. The methods include cut-out, three-dimensional and time-lapse. A version of the gingerbread boy is told through the use of the various animation techniques discussed. (Ages 7-11 years.)

results.title: The Principles and applications of atomic spectra
results.creator_credit: Katrina Rank and Rank Audio Visual
results.brief_description: The film begins with a brief summary of the electromagnetic spectrum, and then makes the point that when electrons in atoms lose or gain energy, radiation with wavelengths ranging from the X-ray to the near infra-red region is emitted or absorbed.

results.title: Wizard
results.brief_description: An animated fairy tale about a small-town wizard who misapplies his magical powers by casting spells on his neighbours. After being rejected by the townspeople the wizard learns that by channeling his imagination to creative ends, he can be both fulfilled and admired.

results.title: Foster's release
results.creator_credit: Terence Winkless, Milton C. Hubatka and Verexal Productions
results.brief_description: A suspenseful drama about a girl who, while babysitting, is the victim of anonymous telephone calls. She tries to have the calls traced. In the taut climax the telephone company and the police work feverishly to reach the girl in time to avert a tragedy. Combines atmospheric music and good use of camera shots including long shots, overhead and close-ups.
